Gumersindo Lafuente

He led the last revamping of El País (elpais.com) online edition, the largest newspaper in Spanish-language. Former editor at elmundo.es when it became the largest news website in Spanish. Founder of SOITU, the only Spanish-media included in the permanent collection of the Newseum. Lecturer at Fundación Gabriel García Márquez.

@sindolafuente

Gonzalo Fanjul

Poverty and development expert. Former research director at Oxfam Spain. For more than a decade he was also one of the leading voices of Oxfam international campaings. He leads the social organization +Social, and collaborates as an associate researcher with ISGlobal and CIECODE. He is co-author of '3.500 Millones', a blog hosted by El País. He studied at the Kennedy School of Government (Harvard).

@gonzalofanjul

Carlos Martínez de la Serna

Journalists working on digital media development and data journalism. Former editor of elmundo.es health channel, the largest health news website in Spanish. Lecturer at several universities, including Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas (Univ. de Austin en Texas) and IE Business School (Madrid). He is currently a John S. Knight fellow at Stanford University.

@cmdelaserna

Isabel de las Casas

Human Rights expert. She has worked at OACNUDH and ACNUR in Spain, Colombia, Rwanda and Swiss. She is currently involved in social organizations +Social and Integra-e. She studied international relations at Tufts University and human rights at Oxford Unversity.

Fernando Espinosa

Senior developer and ruby, Rails and iOS expert. Más de 12 años en front-end y back-end, con experiencia en gestión y desarrollo de proyectos de análisis y visualización de datos como freelance y como parte del equipo de Vizzuality.

@ferdev

Chema Conesa

Fotoperiodista y uno de los editores gráficos más reconocidos de España. Ha trabajado en El País y El Mundo. Es comisario de exposiciones y editor de decenas de libros de fotografía. Premio Bartolomé Ros a la mejor trayectoria española en fotografía.

@chemaconesa
